not_found.name: Unknown
description: Unable to find the requested spellbook.

apprentice_chapbook_of_rul_thaven.name: Apprentice Chapbook of Rul Thaven
description: *This slim book is carefully but amateurishly bound, with leather stretched tight across thin boards. The writing inside is fussy and crammed together, with words that are occasionally illegible. Eight of its pages contain spells; the final 10 pages are blank. A portrait of a plain woman, unsmiling, has been bound into the inside front cover.*

- 1st-{spell/comprehend languages}[^S], {spell/detect secret doors}[^S], {spell/detect undead}[^S], {spell/identify}[^S], {spell/protection from evil}, {spell/protection from law}, {spell/summon monster I}, {spell/true strike}[^S]
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.

arctic_call.name: Arctic Call
description: *Fine vellum sheets fill these two well-worn books. Beautiful illustrations depict the effects of each spell, many with a distinctly arctic theme. Though the pages and their wintry illustrations are of high quality, the protective leather case that encloses both books smells and feels greasy, as if the hide has been crudely waterproofed with animal fat.*
**Protection** fire trap modified to inflict cold damage (Reflex DC 17)
**Value** 4,335 gp (5,985 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 5th-{spell/cone of cold}[^S], {spell/mage's private sanctum}, {spell/permanency}, {spell/teleport}, {spell/wall of force}[^S]
- 3rd-{spell/arcane sight}, {spell/dispel magic}, {spell/elemental aura}[^S], {spell/fire trap}, {spell/heroism}, {spell/lightning bolt}[^S], {spell/phantom steed}, {spell/seek thoughts}
- 2nd-{spell/bull's strength}, {spell/false life}[^OP], {spell/glitterdust}, {spell/hideous laughter}, {spell/make whole}, {spell/resist energy}, {spell/rope trick}

- 1st-{spell/detect secret doors}, {spell/endure elements}, {spell/enlarge person}, {spell/feather fall}, {spell/mage armor}, {spell/magic missile}[^S], {spell/obscuring mist}, {spell/shield}, {spell/shocking grasp}[^S]

**Rime Bite (Su)** You infuse your spell with a biting cold that few can withstand. Spend this boon as a free action when you cast a spell with the cold descriptor. Any damage from that spell ignores all resistance to cold, but does not ignore immunity to cold.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.
[^OP]: A spell from the spellbook creator's opposition school.

arrowsongs_sorrow.name: Arrowsong's Sorrow
description: *This drab leather tome is stamped plainly with elven lettering, appearing at first glance as little more than a journeyman's treatise on spellcasting. Penned into almost every margin, however, are copious notes by an author who identifies herself only as "Arrowsong." These annotations discuss numerous spellcasting fallacies made by the tome's original authors and simple (yet effective) countermeasures that more martially inclined persons can use to disrupt spellcasting. The overall tone of Arrowsong's notes is one of bitter melancholy, and an equal amount of space is dedicated to slanderous poetry directed toward Arrowsong's parents and the book's writers, who might be the same people.*
**Value** 1,200 gp (2,200 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 2nd-{spell/acid arrow}, {spell/arrow eruption}, {spell/protection from arrows}, {spell/scorching ray}, {spell/stone call}

**Disruption Master (Ex)** Arrowsong's claims about the imperfections of spellcasting and the failings of magic provide additional insight into interrupting spellcasting. Unlike other boons, you do not spend this one. Until you prepare spells again, when you damage a foe or the foe fails a saving throw against a spell of yours, the foe also takes a -2 penalty on all concentration checks it attempts for 1 round.

book_of_harms.name: Book of Harms
description: *The leather wrapping of this book is of an indeterminate type, and gives off a faint and unpleasant scent, as of charred meat. The writing inside is in a jagged hand, and many notes on the ash-smudged pages indicate its previous owner sought ever more damaging magic. A glittering rune in the cover's center is shaped vaguely like a lightning bolt.*
**Value** 535 gp (900 gp with the preparation ritual)

- 1st-{spell/burning hands}[^S], {spell/color spray}, {spell/corrosive touch}, {spell/hydraulic push}[^S], {spell/hypnotism}, {spell/magic missile}[^S], {spell/ray of enfeeblement}, {spell/shocking grasp}[^S]

**Harmful Surge (Su)** You can maximize a spell, but doing so damages you. Spend this boon effect as a free action when you cast a wizard evocation spell. When you do, you can treat that spell as if it were cast with the {feat/Maximize Spell} metamagic feat, but you take 1d4 points of damage × the level of the spell that you are maximizing. The damage you take cannot be reduced in any way.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.

book_of_the_grave.name: Book of the Grave
description: *This tome reeks of decomposing flesh or some even fouler stench. Grave mold clings to the worm-eaten cover, and dirt stains the pages. Some pages have been torn out.*
**Protection** The edges of the first three pages are coated with {eq-poison/nitharit} poison (contact; save Fort DC 13; frequency 1/minute for 6 minutes; effect 1d3 Con damage; cure 1 save).
**Value** 815 gp (1,265 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 2nd-{spell/command undead}[^S], {spell/create treasure map}, {spell/ghoul touch}[^S], {spell/spectral hand}[^S], {spell/stone call}, {spell/web}

- 1st-{spell/burning hands}, {spell/chill touch}[^S], {spell/disguise self}, {spell/mage armor}, {spell/protection from good}, {spell/ray of enfeeblement}[^S], {spell/sculpt corpse}[^S], {spell/shield}, {spell/true strike}, {spell/ventriloquism}

*Note:* The original text also contains a 3rd-level spell named "vitriol", but the spell was not included in the source book. (The spell {spell/vitriolic mist} was given, but it's 4th level, out of the range of a 7th-level necromancer.)

**Breath of the Grave (Su)** As a swift action, spend this boon's effect to breathe a 15-foot cone of rotting stench. Creatures within the cone must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + your highest caster level in a class that prepares spells) or be sickened for 1 round. This spends the boon. After this boon has been spent, you take a -4 penalty on Diplomacy and Stealth checks until you prepare spells again.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.

calamaes_fragment.name: Calamaes Fragment
description: *Two gold-plated bronze covers bind this gaudy tome. Several synonyms for "wealth" are neatly chiseled in different languages on the cover.*
- 3rd-{spell/deft digits}, {spell/dispel magic}, {spell/greater magic weapon}, {spell/haste}, {spell/hostile levitation}, {spell/rags to riches}
- 1st-{spell/ant haul}, {spell/jury-rig}, {spell/mage armor}, {spell/magic missile}, {spell/polypurpose panacea}, {spell/shocking grasp}, {spell/sleep}, {spell/tears to wine}

chymists_guidebook.name: Chymist's Guidebook
description: *The pages of this formula book are carefully varnished. Sprinkled among the formulae are details and diagrams of alchemical devices, many of which seem to defy the normal conventions of alchemy and physics. The last page contains incomplete notes on the preparation of experimental mutagens.*
- 2nd-{spell/alter self}, {spell/bear's endurance}, {spell/false life}, {spell/fire breath}, {spell/see invisibility}, {spell/transmute potion to poison}

- 1st-{spell/ant haul}, {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/cure light wounds}, {spell/detect secret doors}, {spell/enlarge person}, {spell/jump}, {spell/keen senses}, {spell/negate aroma}, {spell/shield}, {spell/true strike}

cold_irony.name: Cold Irony
description: *Bound in thin sheets of iron, this book is designed as a series of treatises on divination, information gathering, and rhetoric. The thoughts and notes are so complete as to qualify as a spellbook for the spells listed, despite the fact the author was a bard with no need for a spellbook.*
**Value** 2,420 gp (2,795 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 5th-{spell/foe to friend}, {spell/greater heroism}, {spell/song of discord}, {spell/unwilling shield}
- 2nd-{spell/cure moderate wounds}, {spell/gallant inspiration}, {spell/hold person}, {spell/locate object}, {spell/misdirection}, {spell/perfect placement}
- 1st-{spell/expeditious retreat}, {spell/memory lapse}, {spell/moment of greatness}, {spell/obscure object}, {spell/undetectable alignment}, {spell/vanish}

**Brain Wash (Su)** You combine magic and skill to masterfully manipulate your subjects. You can expend this boon when you cast a spell on a creature you have succeeded at a Bluff, Diplomacy, Knowledge, or Sense Motive check against. You cast that spell at +1 caster level and its save DC increases by 1.

cyrusian_codex.name: Cyrusian Codex
description: *This heavy tome bears a handsome leather cover over thick metal plates. The front cover displays a dozen tiny dials arranged in a semicircle around the locking mechanism.*
**Value** 4,425 gp (9,125 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 2nd-{spell/arcane lock}, {spell/darkness}, {spell/detect thoughts}, {spell/full pouch}, {spell/masterwork transformation}, {spell/shatter}, {spell/silk to steel}, {spell/twisted space}
- 1st-{spell/ant haul}, {spell/burning hands}, {spell/endure elements}, {spell/jump}, {spell/mage armor}, {spell/mirror strike}, {spell/true strike}, {spell/vocal alteration}

**Enduring Alteration (Su)** Your spells resist reality's attempts to restore the things you change. You can spend this boon to apply the benefits of the {feat/Extend Spell} feat to a transmutation spell as you cast it. This also increases the DC to dispel that spell (via {spell/dispel magic} or similar abilities) by 4. This boon does not increase the spell level or casting time of your spell.

defensive_primer.name: Defensive Primer
description: *This surprisingly ornate and heavy volume is more than three-quarters empty. Tightly written notes on the precepts of arcane defense and the vulnerabilities of supernatural entities fill the first two pages.*
- 1st-{spell/burning hands}, {spell/detect undead}, {spell/expeditious retreat}, {spell/magic missile}, {spell/protection from evil}[^S], {spell/ray of enfeeblement}, {spell/shield}[^S]
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.

erages_journeymans_manual.name: Erages Journeyman's Manual
description: *This book is bound in glittering silver bark, and its title is printed in golden calligraphy in both Elven and Common.*
**Value** 575 gp (1,100 gp with the preparation ritual)
**Avoiding Spell (Su)** Whenever you cast a transmutation spell, you can spend this boon as a swift action to gain a +1 dodge bonus to your AC for a number of rounds equal to the spell's level.

galtan_cookbook.name: Galtan Cookbook
description: *This book's cover is illegibly scorched and the pages are wrinkled from water damage.*
**Value** 670 gp (1,270 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 1st-{spell/ant haul}, {spell/bomber's eye}, {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/detect secret doors}, {spell/disguise self}, {spell/expeditious retreat}, {spell/true strike}

**Blast Finesse (Su)** As an immediate action when you throw a bomb, you can spend this boon to shape the blast by adding up to three 5-foot squares to the area, as long as these spaces are adjacent to the bomb's normal area of effect.

grandfathers_legacy.name: Grandfather's Legacy
description: *This pair of lexicons is covered in excellently preserved human skin, with an intricate lace of fingerbones forming the locks on the cover. A family seal has been embossed on the lower center of the cover, but flecks of gold leaf have begun to peel away, revealing that the embossed pattern in fact follows a faded tattoo on the skin itself.*
**Protection** A series of three {eq-misc/superior lock/s} each augmented with {spell/arcane lock} (DC 50) and a {spell/symbol of weakness} (Fortitude DC 20) on the second page of each book.

grimoire_of_glittering_eyes.name: Grimoire of Glittering Eyes
description: *The title of this book is embossed into the scaly cover. Inside, the pages sparkle and gleam in even the faintest light, and the handwriting looks preternaturally clean.*
**Protection** The entire book is warded with {spell/illusory script} (Will DC 16; on failure, the suggestion is for the reader to "Close the book and leave").
**Value** 1,055 gp (1,755 gp with the preparation ritual)

- 1st-{spell/alarm}, {spell/animate rope}, {spell/color spray}[^S], {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/disguise self}[^S], {spell/hypnotism}, {spell/magic aura}[^S], {spell/magic weapon}, {spell/shield}, {spell/sleep}

**Glittering Eyes (Su)** When casting an illusion spell, you gain expanded sight. Spend this boon's effect as a free action when you cast an illusion spell. You gain darkvision 60 feet and a +4 bonus on saving throws to disbelieve illusions, with both benefits lasting for 1 minute.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.
[^OP]: A spell from the spellbook creator's opposition school.

guardian_grimoire.name: Guardian Grimoire
description: *These three well-made books are covered with runes of warding against outsiders and undead. The pages inside show water damage along the edges.*

[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.

insights_of_far_seeing_taernis.name: Insights of Far-Seeing Taernis
description: *These two books are part of a set held together with a leather strap. The covers are of a shimmering and unearthly blue leather, and the spines are built of silver and iron. The books are chilly to the touch, and staring at them induces minor vertigo.*
**Value** 4,555 gp (6,355 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 4th-{spell/acid pit}[^S], {spell/black tentacles}[^S], {spell/dimensional anchor}, {spell/lesser geas}, {spell/phantasmal killer}, {spell/solid fog}[^S]
- 3rd-{spell/gaseous form}, {spell/greater magic weapon}, {spell/magic circle against evil}, {spell/sepia snake sigil}[^S], {spell/spiked pit}[^S], {spell/stinking cloud}, {spell/tiny hut}

*Note:* The original text also contains a 2nd-level spell "fantastical reach" and a 2nd-level conjuration spell named "metabolize", but the spells were not included in the source book.

The creature you summon with that spell gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your caster level, and as long as the summoned creature has at least 1 of these hit points, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus on saving throws.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.
[^OP]: A spell from the spellbook creator's opposition school.

journal_of_the_beast_within.name: Journal of the Beast Within
description: *This ragged collection of scorched and stained notes is tied with cheap twine between wooden covers. A few formulae appear to have been deliberately obliterated, scratched through so thoroughly that the paper is torn in places.*
**Value** 915 gp (2,165 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 1st-{spell/bomber's eye}, {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/crafter's fortune}, {spell/cure light wounds}, {spell/disguise self}, {spell/enlarge person}, {spell/identify}, {spell/shield}

**Beastly Concoction (Su)** This journal grants you the ability to make an extremely potent and savage mutagen. Spend this boon when you imbibe your mutagen. The mutagen grants you a +6 alchemical bonus to your selected ability score instead of the normal +4; you take a -2 penalty to all of your mental ability scores (Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma) while the mutagen is in effect.

journeyman_book_of_rul_thaven.name: Journeyman Book of Rul Thaven
description: *This medium-sized book has a creased spine and supple gray leather covers. The leather has rubbed away in certain spots, tiny pinhole burns pock the surface, and a brass lock holds the book shut. A woman's portrait has been bound into the front cover, and text covers almost all of the image except her face: text in circles, with arrows pointing to new circles with suppositions. Underneath the woman's chin are the words "Diabolist sacrifice?"*
**Protection** {eq-misc/Average lock} (DC 25), and the 5th-level spells are hidden with {spell/secret page}. The special word is "reveal."
**Value** 2,195 gp (3,320 gp with the preparation ritual)

**Eyes of Rul Thaven (Su)** You use a trick perfected by Rul Thaven to ferret out invisible creatures. Spend this boon's effect as a swift action. You gain the effects of {spell/see invisibility} for 1 round.
[^S]: A spell from the caster's specialty school.
[^OP]: A spell from the spellbook creator's opposition school.

lab_journal_of_constance_inflix.name: Lab Journal of Constance Inflix
description: *The steel cover of this slim journal has taken its fair share of abuse; acid scars and minor slag spots show where the journal was subjected to intense working conditions. Equations, balances, and chemical notations mark the margins of the pages - with some formulae, it is difficult to tell where the notes end and the formula begins.*
**Value** 395 gp (770 gp with the preparation ritual)
- 2nd-{spell/blur}, {spell/delay poison}, {spell/fire breath}, {spell/transmute potion to poison}, {spell/vomit swarm}
- 1st-{spell/bomber's eye}, {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/cure light wounds}, {spell/jump}, {spell/keen senses}, {spell/negate aroma}, {spell/resist energy}, {spell/touch of the sea}

**Alchemical Protection (Su)** The alchemical knowledge granted by this book protects you from poisons and alchemical items. Spend this boon's effect as an immediate action when you make a saving throw against poison or an alchemical item but before rolling the saving throw. You gain a +4 bonus on that saving throw.

library_of_the_dancer_of_skins.name: Library of the Dancer of Skins
description: ## Library of the Dancer of Skins

*This quartet of books is held together by a shining silver strand wound around the four tomes and tied in an intricate knot. Inside, the writing is expansive and sloppy, filled with marginalia; the author's notes indicate clear excitement about her discoveries, and while the thinker is obviously brilliant, she is also apparently undisciplined.*
**Value** 16,435 gp (20,710 gp with the preparation ritual)

manual_of_binding.name: Manual of Binding
description: *The three volumes of this set are bound in black sharkskin, the spells inscribed in purple ink on fine paper. Spells conceal extensive notes on constructing a lich's phylactery.*
**Protection** {spell/magic aura} (spellbook appears nonmagical), {spell/secret page} hides the notes on constructing a lich's phylactery, {spell/sepia snake sigil} (Reflex DC 17)

manuscript_of_jack_were_son.name: Manuscript of Jack Were-son
description: *Blood, dirt, wine, and more stain this white leather book. The owner's name, Jack Were-son, is stamped into the cover in peeling gold, yet no more information about the author is immediately evident. Several of the pages contain careful diagrams and illustrations done by a competent but uninspiring artist.*
**Protection** {eq-misc/Average lock} with {spell/arcane lock} (DC 35) and {spell/explosive runes} (Reflex DC 16)

description: *Well-tanned leather binds this sturdy spellbook, with a copper plate of a stylized animal head bolted to the front cover. A foreword filling the first several pages of this book is addressed to "young students of the [Magaambya](rule/aff_i_school)," and offers warnings about the unexpected consequences of using spells without careful consideration. The rest of the book contains spells, each proceeded and followed by one or more stories discussing situations with thematic links to the spell.*
**Value** 375 gp (875 gp with the preparation ritual)

- 1st-{spell/celestial healing}, {spell/comprehend languages}, {spell/detect undead}, {spell/endure elements}, {spell/heightened awareness}, {spell/hydraulic push}, {spell/identify}, {spell/obscuring mist}

**Eyes of Jatembe (Su)** Several of the stories within this spellbook suggest ways to take what information you have and use it to infer the answers to questions for which you don't have proven solutions. Spend this boon when you cast a divination spell to increase the spell's caster level by +2.
